means: （考虑到故事、报告、报道等的夸张或偏见等）不全信

word_mean: 将未到期的一笔资金折算为现在即付的资金数额的行为。也有泛指不同时间的资金数值之间的相互换算。

sentence.Network_cn: 为了尽快售出，我会打折销售。

sentence.Network_en: Eagle Star offers a 10% discount to the over-55s.
sentence.Network_cn: 鹰星公司给予年龄在55岁以上的顾客10％的折扣。

sentence.Network_en: In 1979, Liquor Barn thrived as a discount merchandiser.
sentence.Network_cn: 1979年，LiquorBarn烈酒折扣店的生意十分红火。

jx.jx_en_mean: below the nominal or usual price
jx.jx_cn_mean: 打折的。 比较 at a premium (见 premium)

lj.lj_ly: a scheme which lets tenants buy their homes at a discount.
lj.lj_ls: 可以让租户以折扣价买房的计划。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (denoting a reduction in the amount or value of something): from obsolete French descompte (noun), descompter (verb), or (in commercial contexts) from Italian (di)scontare, both from medieval Latin discomputare, from Latin dis- (expressing reversal) + computare (see compute)

entry.def: A discount is a reduction in the usual price of something.

example.ex: They are often available at a discount...
example.tran: 它们经常进行打折销售。

example.ex: Full-time staff get a 20 per cent discount.
example.tran: 全职员工享受 20% 的折扣。

entry.def: If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price.

example.ex: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand...
example.tran: 这迫使航空公司对机票大幅打折来刺激需求。

example.ex: Tour prices are being discounted as much as 33%.
example.tran: 旅行价格打了 6.7 折之多。

entry.tran: 认为(某种思想、事实、理论)不重要;不全信;认为…不相关
entry.def: If you discount an idea, fact, or theory, you consider that it is not true, not important, or not relevant.

example.ex: However, traders tended to discount the rumor...
example.tran: 然而，商人往往不相信这一谣传。

example.ex: This theory has now been discounted.

means.word_mean: 1. the act of reducing the selling price of merchandise
2. interest on an annual basis deducted in advance on a loan
3. a refund of some fraction of the amount paid
2. give a reduction in price on;

sentences.sentence: "I never discount these books-they sell like hot cakes"

dis去掉+count数,计算→去掉某些数→折扣

Sentence.sentence: Demand a discount on the dishes ordered.
However,if your bond does not have features hat make it attractive to other investors, you may be forced to sell your bond at a discount i.
He also said that he could not discuss discounts to universities for bulk purchases.
Give the customer a ten percent discount.

sentences.en: I can give you a small discount.
That store does not discount at all.
sentences.cn: 那家商店出售商品一概不打折。
那家商店打折出售所有的服装。

means.word_mean: 不考虑; 不全信; 认为…不重要; 对…不全信; 低估

sentences.en: In his plans he discounted the expense.
sentences.cn: 在他的计划中他没有考虑到费用。

means.word_mean: 把(费用、价格等)打折扣；从费用(或账单、价格等)中打去(一部分)折扣

sentences.en: The store promised to discount prices at 10%.
sentences.cn: 该店承诺所有商品打10%的折扣。

means.word_mean: (根据目前的情况)预料到(将发生的事)(以减轻其影响)；预先采取行动，在(某事)发生前采取措施

sentences.en: We had discounted the effect of an earthquake.
sentences.cn: 我们在地震发生前采取了预防措施。

At that shop you can get discount.
